reviewContent: Leaving travelers sitting in the tarmac for over an hour when there is no weather on site after a cross country flight is not acceptable. We can see the weather now rolling on meaning this hour will be extended further escalating aggravation onboard. The airline was quick to clear us as landed in their system to give the facade of a timely travel experience but that is a complete fabrication of the truth. MCO needs to improve the quality of the experience for a city that is supposed to be welcoming of its travelers.

Why is MCO getting worse with each passing week? As a frequent flyer, out of all three terminals, across several carriers, this airport is pathetic. Between the sheer lack of on site parking, the lack of employees that speak English and unimaginably poor ground service, I loathe this place. I will do anything I can to avoid checking a bag because I know I am in for a minimum of a 30 minute wait at baggage claim. That’s on a good day. The wait for a gate to taxi to, the wait for a jet way brought to the plane, then the incredible, inevitable wait at baggage. Carry on only isn’t always an option for me. As one waits, the announcements are made at times only in Spanish, but when they do make it in English, usually secondary to the Spanish, it’s incomprehensible. Listen at any baggage claim, you’ll hear passengers complaining about them. After a ridiculous wait, when you finally get your bag, it’s smash to bits. Every.Single.Time. Of every airport I travel, world wide, my home airport, MCO, is a disaster.

The TSA women are horrible with no manners. They should be saying “thank you for visiting, come back again”. Instead they tell me this is not Universal this is Orlando International Airport when I’m going through the scanner. They speak harshly to some and are nice to some. Second time departing Orlando and they tell me I have something between my legs. They told me either they feel me all over in front of everyone or they take me to a room to strip down. Mind you I’m traveling with a small child. They really need to learn courtesy and be more polite. Is this how they are being trained? This is the Jet Blue TSA ; one had gray hair and the other had red short hair. They picked up my sun screen in my carryon but not the big Fuji bottle in my son’s bag smh. So much for checking and security!

commentHeader: does not have enough parking spaces
reviewContent: My wife arrived on Flight AD8706 arrived 6PM sharp and my wife only left the luggage's/immigration at 7:50. Between the airplane get the finger, luggage available, it took 1 hour and 40 minutes. Immigration was quick. Also the terminal does not have enough parking spaces for it's current operations. This was the third time parking A and C where closed and I had to park elsewhere. Luckily I learned how to park at train station and walked 20 minutes to airport C, avoiding a 30 minutes walking from B parking to C.

This airport has a extremely large number of visitors. Ground transport and flow to and from are fine. Concessions facilities and restaurants are far and few between 1 sit down bar restaurant for many gates waiting lines everywhere, all facilities both male and female have long lines. Very far behind the times, would rather fly to any other airport in they area.

commentHeader: continues to get worse and worse
reviewContent: I live in Orlando, so use this airport frequently. I don't know what is happening but it continues to get worse and worse. I flew internationally for holiday and returned last evening (April 15th). I left out of Terminal A and returned to Terminal C. I parked in North Lot. Apparently you can take a shuttle from C to the South Lot but not the North Lot. WHY? So I had to take a shuttle to Terminal A to then take another shuttle to my vehicle in North Lot. The shuttle took forever to arrive to C. I saw other shuttles (Mears, off site parking etc) circle two or three times while I waited for the shuttle to take me to A. When it did arrive, me and other other 3 passengers all informed him we were going to A, however he dropped us at Terminal B and told us that was his only stop. So I then had to drag my luggage across the airport to get to Terminal A to catch the next shuttle. That shuttle arrived slightly faster, however the driver didn't even get out of his seat to help any of the passengers board. He just sat there staring at us. A nice passenger helped me load my luggage onboard. I had asked a couple people in the airport how to get where i was going and one girl actually told me "it wasn't her job to answer that question". When I did get to my vehicle and went to pay and leave the attendant couldn't have been any more annoyed that I was trying to pay her. She barely could extend her arm to take my payment and seemed severely pissed off she had to actually perform a function. I traveled to three countries and therefore three airports and am sadly embarrassed how our city is represented with regard to our airport. After customs and retrieving my bags, it took me 2 hours to get to my vehicle last night which is horrible. Why is there no shuttle to North Lot from C? Why doesn't the shuttle that is supposed to take you to A not actually take you to A? Why are the workers so rude and unhelpful. Really poor on MCO's part.
Worst wheelchair assistance experience ever. Attendant assigned to me did not speak enough English to understand my needs, ended up parking me off to the side and walked away!

This was the worst airport experience in my life. Very Rude People. Very Few Facilities.  The public announcements were a joke and they were being read like it a joke by a person who sounded about 10 years old. They kept repeating that people are not allowed to use phones in the terminal, and yet looking around guess what, everyone is on their phones because that's what travellers need to do! Being asked to pay $30 for a baggage trolley. (£1 in the UK). Massive queues for the immigration lanes - we waited for over 2 hours. This terminal is very badly designed. No opportunity to purchase any refreshments and no seats. There are no shops whatsoever in the airport on the way to the hire car. (we rented a villa so a shop would have been really handy) Outbound - Similar experience, very few shops and no opportunity to buy any duty free. Encountered extremely rude & cranky TSA operatives. I ended up getting angry myself at the way I was being shouted at and left my iPad/tablet behind. It would have been fine but the tray with this item ended up on a different conveyer belt and I didn't realise I'd left it behind until I was on the flight. To add insult to injury, MCO Lost and Found have said the only option to get my item returned will cost me $349 via UPS. This is an absolute joke as the UPS website quotes me a fraction of this price. The item itself is worth about $150. When you consider MCO auctions thousands of lost electrical items for profit (ggauctionsonline.net), this little operation seems to be lining somebody's pockets at MCO. I had high hopes for this visit but I never dreamt I'd end up being financially exploited by the richest country in the world.

The airport staff and TSA were crotchety, not at all helpful with my disabled family member either. A lady stands at the family and disabled TSA line entrance and basically gate keeps it. We explained we had an autistic family member and she still tried to deny us access, she was so rude. Not at all up on the TSA cares policy in the least!  Do not recommend. Oh but don't worry they gave me a sunflower lanyard that no one paid any attention to.

commentHeader: a big improvement on previous visits
reviewContent: Arrival and departure into the new Terminal C at MCO. I have to say it was terrific. Through immigration in 10 minutes and into a rental car 15 min after that. Departure was equally as good. No Queues at security and a good selection of Eating places, including Shake shack. We only had hand luggage which is important to state, but it was a big improvement on previous visits.

commentHeader: Shockingly poor from start to finish
reviewContent: Shockingly poor from start to finish. Could not disembark on arrival as ground crew had a problem with connecting equipment - about 30 minutes extra. Allegedly only ‘one belt’ was working for baggage - waited 2 hours with lack of seating, people lying on the floor etc waiting to get bags. We asked if our elderly parents could go through passport control and get a seat, while we waited for the luggage. We were told yes, this would be fine. Then when our parents attempted to do this they were spoke to in a demeaning tone and said they couldn’t do this. Totally understand that things can go wrong in any industry, but a timely, consistent and courteous approach are some of the best ways of dealing with problems and maintaining or improving customer relationships and experiences. Orlando Airport is the worst airport I have ever had to use.

I have unfortunately had to travel to or through MCO with some frequency over the years and it is always chaotic and the employees have no sense of urgency. To get through the line to have baggage checked by security can take very little time but the screening process takes forever if they have to pull your bags. It requires a supervisor who has led feet and all slow the process down and make things annoyingly tedious. There were 4 people in wheelchairs awaiting their baggage for almost a half hour while I and 4 others were also waiting for someone to expedite the process of opening and checking bags.  Service is slow all over, there is nowhere to sit and when you do find a seat it’s covered in crumbs, old turkey and goo from the 1980s. No where to charge your phone or get work done. Not business friendly whatsoever.  No retail spaces to pass the time. Folks sitting on the floors everywhere you look. The only pluses are that’s it’s usually cheap, car rental return is easy and the tram always seems pretty clean. Just get some real seating please.

One of the worst tourist airports I have visited. Over two hours for baggage to be retrieved on arrival and then an incredibly slow departure from the airport as you pass through customs. On departure, only 2 out of 12 security lines open (in the middle of the day) which resulted in over an hour queue to exit. This is my third trip through Orlando airport in the last four months and it’s a consistently poor experience every time.
The TSA was very rude and did not treat people as customers. They were confused about what they wanted you to do, and then they started yelling at people. Very poor service!

This is the worst Airport ever! My son was scheduled to depart from there last night when his flight was delayed. Then they got on the next flight but it left the gate only to return back to the airport. They were told that they were going to have to board a different flight due to something with the plane. Only to find out that they wouldn't be able to board another flight departing until Saturday. The airline nor airport would accommodate them in no way. I have been calling since last night until current leaving messages and getting the run around. This was my son 1st experience on a plane to celebrate his birthday and look what happens. There's no direct customer service number for the airline which doesn't make sense.

Upon arrival at Orlando the Customs were excellent and very quick, our luggage arrived very promptly too - we opted to take our luggage on the mono-rail with us and were out of the airport within 45 minutes - excellent service all round. We also Departed on 11th May, the departure was awful, our Virgin Check-in was faultless, the Security was AWFUL, so long and disorganised, its been like this for the last 22 years and never gets any better, very long queues and half the security lanes closed - why! (the staff though are lovely). When we got to the area where we departed from all the food areas were closed (9pm), our flight did not leave until 10.20 - Outback Steak House could not seat us as they only had 1 member of staff working, it was the same for the other outlet. The Duty Free, which is the worst Duty Free I have ever seen, no stock at all also shut at 9pm! If you have flights going out with 100's of people of those flights you should have some outlets open to feed them, the lounges close at 9pm too. Totally unacceptable service.
Restrooms outdated and small. Staff is slow and unwilling to help. Security lines can be up to a mile. Limited seating at the gates. Expect to walk a lot navigating terminals and the trams.

commentHeader: never experienced a new terminal as bad as this
reviewContent: I have never experienced a new terminal as bad as this. You have to walk half a mile up hill to get to baggage claim after a long flight. I saw people stopped and hyperventilating. Then the wait for bags is absurdly long. I am not quite sure if they have more than a few people unloading planes. Then the border patrol guy gave me a lecture on how wonderful Florida is because you don’t pay income tax. I see what not paying income tax does to infrastructure. Then rechecking bags is confusing and unclear. Overall I give the new MCO a D minus.

As a frequent flyer and Orlando area resident, I was flabbergasted by the impoverished appearance and user unfriendliness of this brand new terminal C. Plain, unadorned beige walls. Shockingly scuffed and marred floors. Crudely finished bathroom floor. Marathon walk to bag claim. It looked like a low bid renovation of a bus terminal. The huge ceiling height and skylights made me wonder about cooling costs. I felt bad for my fellow travelers, walking the long distances after a 10 hour flight, undistracted by color, design, or assistance. I appreciated the airport ambassador who directed us, and the courteous passport control folks. However, I am shocked by this building, and embarrassed for the image of Orlando that it gives to visitors to the City Beautiful.

The new terminal in Orlando is terrible. Lines are long, service is lacking and rude, the building is very big and confusing. Took almost an hour to get our luggage and then we had to wait another 10+ minutes to get a walker (brought from somewhere else - it was on the same plane). Will not book any MCO flights in the future with any carrier in that terminal.

Wait times are insane. People arriving 2+ hours early were missing flights left and right because security lines were taking more than an hour and 15 minutes. We made our flight with 30 seconds to spare after SPRINTING through the airport.

commentHeader: Our luggage took one hour to arrive
reviewContent: We arrived at Orlando via Terminal C which is the terminal BA and Aer Lingus to name but two now use for their flights. On arrival we had to go upwards via a sloped incline to arrive at an upper level where a sign indicated how far it was to baggage reclaim (it stated an 8 minute walk). This is not at all accurate for families with small children or for anyone with any sort of mobility issue. There are no moving walkways of any kind or seating prior to arriving into the baggage reclaim area prior to entering immigration/passport control. Our luggage that day took one hour to arrive; this was due to inclement weather and problems with unloading the aircraft. Some of the TSA staff at departures could benefit from more training in customer relations. Airside area is clean and has a few shops and eating places in it prior to arrival at the gate area. Be prepared for a long walk to your flight if your gate for this is at the end of the corridor.

commentHeader: worst to spend any time in at all
reviewContent: Of all the airports, this is the worst to spend any time in at all. NO working outlets for charging phones or electronics. Restrooms for women require long waits and today was relatively clean, but in the past has not been good at all. Limited food vendors and few choices. I avoid this airport whenever possible and really wish it was traveler friendly. People sitting on the floor because there are not enough seats. Queue lines in the walkway that makes it difficult to move around.

Who designed this monstrosity? This is the absolute worst airport experience I've ever had, and the absolute worst at MCO. We arrived yesterday at Terminal C from a British Air 9-hour flight. We were met with an uphill incline (and we had baggage with us). We are in our 70s and had to stop several times to catch our breath. Besides the steep incline, this is very antiseptic looking. Once I regained my breathing, I thought to myself that if I were a first-time traveler to the United States, I'd want to turn around and go home. Took a long time to get baggage, but we were on a large plane. Our plane arrived early at 6:25 pm, and our ticket said 6:50 arrival. We had family coming to pick us up, and they had to keep circling around. We left Terminal C around 7:30 pm. Absolutely ridiculous. Worst news for me is that I'm scheduled to fly Icelandair in November, and I'll be dreading that arrival for the next several months. Invest a buck or two, people! Install some escalators!

Everything from parking, lines at ticket counters, security, food kiosks and restaurants are all crowded and severely understaffed. You don’t have time to complete a purchase because the lines are long with usually one employee serving a very long line. Hyatt hotel is overpriced, air conditioning doesn’t work well. Rooms are humid despite being cooler. Sub par all the way around.

commentHeader: worst airport I have ever been to
reviewContent: The worst airport I have ever been to. Over an hour now getting through security. Very close to missing my flight. Machines that I think were operating in the 80's. Understaffed but yet incompetent and uncaring security. This airport is/should be an embarrassment to the state of Florida

Orlando MCO guest services need to have professional training, in the event when you have a delayed flight that turns into a canceled flight with customers who have been waiting on a flight from 5:40pm to 11:40pm with children involved it becomes a high stress environment for everyone, the fact that the staff where mocking customers laughing at customers and taking their frustrations out on customers that was just uncalled for uncomfortable.

Its 9:30 pm - our flight was delayed. Food stores are closed. The duty free is closed. This is an international airport - at 9:30 pm everything is closed and some Which are still open are closing at 10pm. So their food is all done. Travelling with my 80 year old Mom who is diabetic and can't find anything for her to eat.

Where to start, from the extremely long walks, starting at security, the tiny bathrooms (only two stalls) lack of seating, limited food options. From last gate 230 to main hall where most the food is will take you 15-20 minutes to walk there. The upside down nature departures on lower levels, aerials on upper. Constant elevation changes. Don’t know why you would put carpet on the international walkways. Airports have been in operations for a century and designers still can’t figure them out. Oh and don’t forget the walk to train to walk if you are connecting to another airline plan 40 minutes at minimum. Waste of 2.8 billion if you ask me

I felt overly confined at this airport on how you have to take a shuttle to get in and out of it. I brought carry on so as to keep the trip chaotic free and an attendant that was checking the bags through the device chose to take one of my bags further and took two containers away. One was a gel that was over 3.5 oz. The other was a solid sea salt scrub and he claimed it was a gel and did not look into the container to see the texture of it. You have the scrape the product out with a stick it is so stiff. If that couldn't go on the plane as a carry on why was my deodorant allowed? I feel It was a pure and easy theft. I don't think it's right for one attendant to have the only judgement in order to get away with taking anything they pleases like that.

commentHeader: issues that need to be addressed"
reviewContent: Although the expansion of Orlando airport is amazing, there are some issues that need to be addressed. Size of terminal, and lack of assisted transportation for those with disabilities. Coordination of rental car agencies. We arrived in terminal C and needed to find transportation back to terminal B. This took about an hour to finally get to our rental vehicle. Should have assigned or made it possible to pick up a car at terminal C. I understand that terminal C opened recently, logistics around the airport should have be planned as the terminal was being built. A lot seems to be after thoughts.

Inconsiderate staff. Complete mess and utter chaos. Airport setup is confusing. No coordination whatsoever. Good luck finding your way around in this labyrinth. International flight and domestic flight were departing from the same terminal which made everyone miss their flight. Any sort of argument or pleading with the staff was futile.

Lines for checking in were understaffed so the lines were long and unpleasant. The lines for going through security were impossibly long. That area was clearly understaffed. The monitor claimed it would take 23-25 minutes, but it took us 45 minutes. The waiting area for Delta was filthy. The chairs were disgusting. Many of the chairs were actually broken. There were not enough places for people to sit. The food available was very substandard, and the selection was way too limited. The bathrooms were marginal and unpleasant. Often 2 or 3 announcements were blasting at the same time making it impossible to understands any of them.

commentHeader: Terminal C arrival is a nightmare
reviewContent: Terminal C arrival is a nightmare. After a 4 hour delay we arrived late, the walk from the gate to the baggage claim is long. Very difficult for even minor mobility issues. There were at least places to stop and rest along the way. It is a very long walk across multiple levels with no moving sidewalks or golf carts. It probably took me 1/2 hour to reach the baggage claim where I waited another hour for the bags. Decided to walk over to the car rental desk to find out where to get the car. Turns out you either have another long walk to take the tram to terminal B or you wait 30 mins for a bus. My flight landed at 10 and I got to my Disney Hotel at 2.00 am. Will be hard pressed to fly any airlines using Terminal C unless they make improvements.

Terminal C is horrible. Very poorly designed. The walk from the gate to baggage is so long with no people movers. I use a walker and I know that no one with any kind of mobility issues will be able to walk the half mile to baggage. To get to baggage also requires going up two levels. Yes there are elevators but the buttons are at the end of the bank of 3. I literally pushed the button 3x and the elevator opened and closed before I could reach it. The fourth time I ran and managed to jam my walker into the closing door to get it to open. Signage is also not very clear, but three of us finally figured out how to get to baggage. I was last off the plane, had to wait 10 min for my walker, took 20 min to walk at a decent pace to get to baggage, was directed to the wrong carousel and when I arrived at the correct carousel the bags still were not coming out. There were 5 stops before I finally got my bag over 30 minutes AFTER I reached baggage. From the time we reached the gate until I got my bag, was over 70 minutes! At the VERY LEAST this terminal needs people movers. If you have ANY mobility issues or are even a little out of shape count on 20 min to get to your gate you are almost forced to take a wheelchair even if you normally can navigate with a cane or walker. Terminal C is a nightmare. I hope they correct the problems before I fly Jetblue again. So poorly designed.

Orlando airport terminal C has a steep walk of about 10 minutes upon arrival. This is not consumer friendly at all, particularly for older people like myself and my wife. They don’t have any alternative arrangement like escalator or elevator. This is really shameful! No other airport in the US or anywhere in the world is so unfriendly and inconsiderate to senior citizens like us.

commentHeader: Terminal C is not age friendly
reviewContent: A brand new Terminal C. Once you have checked in and head towards security they have a coral. Now with 8 people already at security and a attendant or whatever they call her standing there. My husband who is 80 and suffers from Neurapathy and I am 70 suffers from arthritis we had to walk back and forth back and forth about 6 time. It did not occur to this person to lift the rope for us to go straight ahead as there was nobody else there. I could understand if there was a queue. This Terminal C is not age friendly. The next time we fly Aer Lingus we will have to take a wheel chair that otherwise would not be needed .

Just returned from Thanksgiving trip on JetBlue from Albany NY. Our trip out was easy enough but our return was a nightmare. We arrived at 8.03 at Terminal C. Had to walk over a 1/2 mile from the gate to baggage claim, up 2 floors to get to baggage claim area. There was no tram cars available to get a ride on. I am 75 yrs old and my wife is 72. We both have to issues walking distances, and needed to stop a few times to carry on. At the baggage claim we didn’t get our bags until 9.00. This is not a terminal to use for the elderly or those who have problems walking.

Terminal C - what happened with the design of this $2 Billion investment? The parking lot is a nightmare! The arrival hall is on the second floor and the departure on the bottom. Who flipped it on its head? The train station is bigger than average European airport train stations and there are no trains for at least another year and then there will only be a train that goes in one direction to Miami and stops in Cape Canaveral for the cruise connection. Everything in this airport is awkward to say the least. All the food outlets are after security and the multi floor building looks like a greenhouse that lets the sun in - and this in Florida? What about sustainability and eco friendly mess.  I am saddened at the thought of the expense of such an expansion of a major airport that starts of at the wrong foot. It is clear that the designers never traveled abroad and checked in at other airports from Beijing to Singapore or Hong Kong just to mention a few new airports that are inviting and welcoming.  The proof is clearly in the day to day operation: I counted 20 ambassadors helping travelers find their way just from the parking lot to the security area on a regular light travel afternoon. Check it out for yourself!

commentHeader: Arrival at the new terminal C was a joke
reviewContent: Arrival at the new terminal C was a joke. First the key code to the jetway was lost so we waited 40+ minutes to get off of the plane. Than you have to walk a half mile to the baggage claim up a maze of walkways that are not friendly to passengers that are ederly or have health issues. Than there were only a few customs agents and 500-600 people trying to get through. Took an hour from plane through customs. Than nobody picks up at C because its to far away so you have to walk another half of a mile to the tram, take it to A or B and then catch your transportation. We could have driven to Fort Lauderdale and flown from there and it would have been faster than traveling terminal C. The desighn is terrible.  I blew out my knee 3 weeks ago and it was just on the mend and now it's re-inflamed. This terminal should be shut down.

We used to like this airport, but terminal C is a nightmare! 15 minutes until our airplane reached it's parking position, then a 10 minute walk to the baggage claim - no moving walkways - very bad, if you had a long flight, waiting for the bags to arrive and then waiting again for immigration. We touched ground at 6.15pm and exited the airport around 8pm - there were only 2 other flights coming in at that time, imagine, what happens, if it is busy.

commentHeader: Terminal C just isn't ready for passengers
reviewContent: Terminal C just isn't ready for passengers. Poor/no road signage, no staff on hand for assistance, no car rentals available, baggage claim woefully inadequate, not allowed to bag drop at terminal instead have to go to terminal A&B and make the long hot outdoor journey from the train to terminal, no trolleys available for transfer to terminal, poor seating, no decent restaurants open, no vending machines, restrooms soaking wet with no hand soap, all staff claim not to work there. Only upside is TSA employees actually have a personality. Honestly, be prepared to be underwhelmed and bring water.

Absolutely worst TSA service out of every airport I've ever flown from and/or to. My girlfriend is a diabetic and we were waiting on our connecting flight. I asked 3 different TSA agents whether we would be allowed back through after having to leave out the terminal to even find a vending machine. All 3 said that we could re-enter with no problem. Once we attempted to reenter we were then told that we couldn't and would have to wait until 3am when they could process us because our flight left at 0830. Keep in mind I had already provided connecting flight info to the 3 that I previously asked to avoid having to wait in the long line that will be formed by then. Not a one mentioned that I would have to wait. All 3 told me and my girlfriend that as long as we were back by 12am then we could get through. To make it even better, the night supervisor Alberto was extremely rude and unprofessional and talked to me like I was below him and had a very condescending attitude. I will be directly contacting TSA regarding this and this will be the only time that I ever set foot in this airport again. Any future travel plans to the city of Orlando are hereby gone from my thoughts if this is the quality of service that they provide.

commentHeader: 75 minutes to get through passport control
reviewContent: We landed at the airport and it took over 7 minutes to reach our docking station at Terminal C. We were some of the first off due to the class of ticket we had purchased. We then had a 7 minute walk up hill to reach the baggage claim area. There were 4 such carousels and we waited just under 1 hour to collect out bags. They seemed to arrive just about 10 at a time and then wait more until the next 10 came. We were very lucky as just on other carousel was being used. We then had to wait 75 minutes to get through passport control. The old system allowed you to pass through passport control first so the first class passengers went through first. This also allowed time for the bags to arrive and then you were on your way. Passport control first makes the whole process much faster. We then had to walk a far way to reach the trains to Terminal B in order to pick up our car. We landed at 7.25pm and we drove away just before 10.00pm. Someone needs to look into this as passengers will choose airlines that still arrive at Terminal B.

commentHeader: Extremely poor planning of the layout
reviewContent: Extremely poor planning of the layout and opening for the new C Terminal. Be prepared to walk “7 minutes” (a sign tells you like you’re on the freeway lol) up hill to get to the baggage and customs area. Then be prepared to wait another hour plus to get your luggage, presumably because of the distance. Then wait to catch a bus to terminal B to get a car, etc. It’s not even beautiful. The flooring choice couldn’t have been a cheaper epoxy. I noticed the ceiling tiles in the main baggage hall were already dirty since I had nothing to do while waiting for luggage (you’re not supposed to use your phone in this area). Oh yeah, the LED signs were really nice if you ignore all the wires hanging out from the sloppy installation,

commentHeader: don’t want to wait for a bag for 1.5 hours
reviewContent: British Airways flight from London, arrived at 630 and no gate sat on runway for 35 minutes, then some gate issues. Gate issue was British airways problem plane in gate had mechanical issues. Now the fun starts, the walk to customs was a long one, elderly will have an issue with the walk time. In the new terminal international flight baggage is sent directly to the customs area. So you are supposed to pickup your bag and go directly to customs. Now this sounds like a great idea but it’s a disaster. After the long walk I hit the baggage claim at 715 pm, another British airways flight on the same baggage carousel and it’s huge. I finally received my bag at 8.25 pm. I believe they are shipping the bags via conveyor from the gate to customs, that is a long haul and it showed. When I left at 8.25pm, 1/3 plane still waiting for their bags. Plane landed at 6.30pm didn’t get home till 10pm with 1/2 hour ride home. If the long conveyor ride for the bags is the problem they have to fix this and quickly, after a 8 hour plus flight you don’t want to wait for a bag for 1.5 hours.

Our arrival was to terminal A, but our departure coincided with our airline moving to the new terminal C. It’s quite a distance to there, and after walking down long corridors, and negotiating various lifts we finally arrived. Before check in there is only one place to get refreshments, and they were terrible. Despite a board showing a variety of coffee, the only offering from the poorly trained staff was plain coffee , given plastic cup and told to fill it myself from a tepid jug. Check in staff also untrained and dismissive, barely polite. Security another nightmare of errors and misscanning. Airside no better, very little choice of refreshments and a vast almost empty area. Again staffed by poorly trained staff. Worst experience ever, how can you open a new facility in such a busy airport, and not have all the training in place. Never again.

commentHeader: my first and last time here
reviewContent: Why would an authority open a terminal that has no restaurants, no bars, no shops, no currency exchange, no coffee shops, and the ticket counters lack ability to correspond with the airlines for customer service questions. Why pretend to open on time when the terminal was clearly not ready? Clearly the management has no consideration for travelers, nor shows proper management skills. Better to drive to Tampa with their world class airport. This is my first and last time here.

commentHeader: I had an overall good experience
reviewContent: I had an overall good experience at MCO. While I don't think most airports warrant the reviews they usually get, no airport will ever get a 10/10 rating because the staff are always indifferent, tired, and unfriendly and Orlando is no exception. But they kept everyone moving effectively. Most memorable were the bartenders at the Outback steakhouse in Airside 4. They were in good spirits and seemed eager to be good hosts. The central building was clean and nicely designed. I don't know what it is with Florida airports and monorails, but the system to get you to the gates worked smoothly. The airside building with the gates had a good design because there were lots of amenities in the central part and from there it was 5 minutes or less to any gate. I will warn you that your experience is bound to suck if bad weather causes delays. My flight was delayed 2.5 hours because of a torrential thunderstorm. Orlando is busy because so many small planes are arriving from various places across the country. Delta must have a flight to Atlanta alone every hour. That meant that when the storm ended, the delayed flights were departing at the same time as the flights that hadn't been temporarily diverted. The halls with the gates became extremely crowded and it took almost an hour to takeoff as my flight had to wait in a bloated queue for takeoff.

We arrived within the airline recommended window to catch our 6am flight with what we thought was time to spare. After waiting in one line (following signs) we were told to move to another line for self baggage check-in, only to then have to move to another line to wait in to actually check our bags as if the airline wants as little customer interaction possible. Staff have been polite but a very standoff-ish, forced polite. We then waited in TSA line for well over an hour although a 24 minute wait was posted, rushed to the gate only to be told, along with about 20 others, that our flight was no longer boarding with no guidance or assistance as to what to do to rectify the situation. We secured an alternative flight home on our own, but the two waiting areas at the gates we sat in while waiting were both infested with ants. This flight, 9 hours later, was eventually delayed by 40 minutes and ultimately over 2 hours. Just issue after issue in an unclean place with unsympathetic sometimes rude workers.

commentHeader: I am sorry but you should not treat anyone like that
reviewContent: I don't have the words to describe what an absolute disaster this airport has become. I have lived in Orlando for 34 years and fly frequently. My entire family, adults with their family flew to Dallas. We got there in plenty of time and went to each park 2 cars in the A/B parking lot. There was no signage stating it was full and had to go to the new terminal C. We entered the garage to be told we had to exit and go to C, which by the way is further and unknown. We left and both have clear to be told by an attendant it was a charge of $1.00. We asked how since you could not provide us parking and also exited as soon as we could. Then we drove to C and each parked. The signage there is terrible and also very isolated. My daughter, 6 year old grand daughter got lost and ended up in a closed parking lot. Finally my son was at shuttle and guided me to the terminal to take the shuttle. By then I was so upset I wanted to cry. We finally got to the main terminal and used clear but my son and family got stuck in the security line. His family thankfully made it only because Spirit was running late. Had it been on time they could have missed their flight. We as a family did our part arriving with ample time. This could have been avoided by letting people now to go only to terminal C. I am sorry but you should not treat anyone like that. Travelling these days has become harder and harder. Don't put more stress on us. We pay a lot to fly with most airlines just awful. I hope this is read by someone that will attempt to make it a better situation. My family has to fly to California in July and honestly we are all dreading it already.

The TSA is absolutely atrocious, they can’t process individuals fast enough because some of the members rather have conversations with the customers instead of processing them. The lines literally stretch across the airport so you would think it goes without saying to keep your conversation to a minimum. Beyond that, the airport is actually fine.

Airport was fine, but check in was a mess! Checking bags took 45+min and TSA was a joke! 1-2hr wait with lots of stops because the line was so long they couldn't process people. My 3year old had apple juice in a Disney sippy cup that was confiscated (apparently only 2 and under need or get to keep drinks), but we flew here with it no problem. In turn we missed our plane by minutes. At least we got to watch our flight leave us. TSA thanks for keeping America safe from Apple juice. Now we can spend $5 and deal with a upset toddler.

Horrible experience, didn’t even give a military discount to us as it’s “only for current and active” members. Half of our items we put through TSA were broken after they shoved them in and were not accommodable whatsoever. Plane didn’t even leave for an hour plus after everyone was seated.

commentHeader: it was chaos and no one was friendly or helpful
reviewContent: You know it is not always the passenger that is in the wrong. Our party of 15 came in with time to check in. The hotel should have sent the shuttle about 30 minutes earlier, but we made it to the airport. From there it was chaos and no one was friendly or helpful. I know the staff must be under a lot of stress, but that is no reason to be rude and unhelpful to the passengers who just want to get to their destination. Not all of us want to prove a point, and we all were ok with wearing the proper mask and thought we were following the proper rules. Because of the TSA lines and overkill on patting down passengers and 10 steps in the wrong direction, and a very rude and probably tired official there were 3 out of the 15 who missed the flight and spent the next 29 hours getting home. Because of this there were 3 seats that could have been used by 3 people in need, but used by the 3 of us who needed to get home. Our flight that we should have been on, had 3 empty seats. Because of this action at the airport 3 of us slept in the airport, was witness to a person walking around nude at 3am in the Orlando airport, waited for security to attend to this poor confused person 25 minutes, and had to fly to Dallas and then from there to Madison WI. The rude and overkill with the TSA team slowed down the process even more. There are always two sides to every story.

commentHeader: I'm totally shocked with their treatment
reviewContent: My family arrived at the airport in plenty of time to catch their flight back to the UK only to stand in the check in queue for an hour and twenty minutes and only move a few feet. On trying to do self check in unsuccessfully they asked for help only to be treated very rudely by airport staff. They then went back to the check in queue and again approached several members of staff as there was only an hour till their flight left and again were treated very badly by the most unhelpful staff. They eventually made their flight with minutes to spare my sister who was travelling has MS and is in a wheelchair the stress of her flight home had totally put her off coming again as any stress impacts on her MS symptoms. I'm totally shocked with their treatment especially as MCO is usually excellent with disabled passengers.

commentHeader: never fly to or from here again
reviewContent: If you have to catch a flight out of here make sure you’re here a day early because you are guaranteed to miss your flight waiting in line through security.  Everything is done slowly and poorly with no regards to anyone's time. I will never fly to or from here again, I rather pay hundreds of dollars in Lyft fees to fly into other Florida airports but Orlando.

commentHeader: the dirtiest airport I have ever seen
reviewContent: This is without a doubt the dirtiest airport I have ever seen. As I wait to board my flight I am sitting next to an ant infestation. There is food all over the ground and no custodial personnel anywhere. Absolutely disgusting. Bathrooms horrifying.

It's a clean and straightforward airport. A lot of little food places to visit and seating if you need it. However, the TSA staff there is extremely rude. I understand they have to take their jobs seriously however, they do not need to treat us paying travelers like we're pieces of garbage. I'm a young woman traveling alone and I don't need any man talking down to me and you can't even get "thank you, have a nice day," from them. They were extremely rude about the mask I wore and told me to put a real mask on, even though it covered my mouth and nose. The mask I wear is an alternative for my asthma and how I am able to comply with it where it's needed. Meanwhile there were people walking around with none on at all so I don't even want to hear it. Maybe you need to train your people in common courtesy to others to make it a more pleasant experience while you're there. Glad they keep it clean and tidy, but seriously, get your security acting right with the paying customers who are supporting their paycheck.

commentHeader: Maybe we will be driving to Florida next time
reviewContent: The lady pushing the bins into the scanner was beyond rude. As I thought the bin was stuck, not that she purposely pushed it at an angle, I fixed it and she picked it up and slammed it back down to back to being at an angle. If I saw this is how she wanted it you think I would I fixed it? No, I would’ve left it. This lady needs some sunshine from this so called sunshine state. We get it you’re busy but the other workers were pleasant and joked around. The same worker also stated what you don’t care about your belongings? As they’re motioning for us to go through the scanning. Well if our items were pushed through and not held for so long we would’ve been fine. Maybe we will be driving to Florida next time.

commentHeader: TSA was super friendly and quick
reviewContent: TSA was super friendly and quick. I lost my Apple Watch during security check, my own fault. I panicked and TSA helped me and looked with me for my watch. They gave me an number to contact them and and fill out forms online. I got a call back the same day and they told me the great news that they found my Apple watch! I am super happy with their quick response and customer service!

commentHeader: Not bad service but it could be better
reviewContent: Very fast security. Staff could be friendlier and more clear with their directions. Bathrooms weren’t very clean. The chipotle ran out of almost everything. Not bad service but it could be better.

What an awful airport. The TSA was fine however the layout, sanitation, seating, is awful. For being the happiest place on earth I would say don’t bother. Disney, Universal, Sea World all need to step in and force this city to step up their game. No cold drinks to buy, luggage takes for ever to get unloaded, bathrooms broken, dirty and sinks not working. With the amount of money coming through this airport. There is no reason not to elevate. Shame on you Orlando. Take care of your travelers.

commentHeader: no need for the dirty smelly airport!
reviewContent: I have come and gone from this airport for many years, l haven’t flown for a couple of years because of Covid. In July of 2021 l visited my son for a week. I flew Frontier from Rochester to Orlando which was just fine but the experience back was less than pleasant. The staff at the airport seemed to be trained in inconsiderate customer service. They’re rude and crude for the most part. I will say that the gentlemen that checked me in at the Frontier counter was very pleasant. He was THE only pleasant employee l experience during my 2 hour stay in the airport. The worst thing l encountered is that airport gate 16 smelled liked urine no matter where stood or sat. I feel that this is the one airport that should be setting an example for our nation since it is the number one vacation destination. Get it together Orlando! There is no need for the dirty smelly airport!

Very rude TSA. Not 1 person I encountered was nice! Traveled with many family members. On the way to security checkpoint, 1st TSA encounter: was yelled at while I was with my two young children (to walk shoulder-to-shoulder side by side: difficult to do when 1 child was in a stroller). 2nd encounter near check point was told to scan my tickets with another very rude TSA worker who called me back as I was about to walk to get a body scan, he was upset and had a very mean/annoyed facial expression. Again yelled at: “who are they!” I replied “my children Sir, I scanned my ticket sir”. 3rd Encounter and thankfully the last! I had to dump my sons water from his bottle at a close trash bin (didn’t happen at JFK airport where I’m originally from as the TSA there was friendly and performed a test to check the water, lady smiled and I was on my way). Had to throw away a plastic spray/sip bottle that I was unaware contained approximately 1 ounce of water. I asked if he can just please allow me to dump that water out as well and was told “No, it’s too late” but he let me dump my sons water from his bottle. I was totally confused as I watched him confiscate it. He then checked my sons backpack and took his 4 oz unopened juice box and tossed it! As I said before I was traveling with many other family member and other children who were all able to keep their juice boxes from another TSA worker a different line. Worst experience of my life traveling through Orlando Florida airport! And I’m from NYC.

We arrived at the airport 2 hours early as a precaution of the long security checks. We got through the security checks after 30 minutes (what a relief) so our family of 6 decided to use the lounge membership before departure. Our departure is Terminal B gate 35. One of the lounge is located in Terminal B, gate 1-29. We took the tram to the lounge. After finished, we have to take the tram back to tram lobby area (this is the security clearance area after the checkpoint) to take another tram to our gate 35. The TSA employee closed the door and told us we all have to exit and go through security check again, although we have already waited in line and completed the security checks for 6 people. We had only 10 minutes to complete the security checks before our plane boards. The tram for gate 1-29 is the only tram that is separated by "Exit" door once the passengers depart the tram lobby area. The logistic of this tram design is so absurd that even though passengers already went through security check, but if you use the lounge (tram 1-29), and have to depart to any other gate, you have to go through security again. Airport Logistics Department need to re-assess this as this will cause passengers to crowd checkpoint lines and miss their flight. Very frustrated that this happened.

commentHeader: I’ve never seen anything like it in my life
reviewContent: Literally the worst airport experience I’ve ever had in my life. If you can help it at all, do not fly into or out of this airport. We were departing back to Philadelphia from Florida yesterday and arrived at the airport with 2 hours and 45 minutes before our flight. Walked into a line wrapped around the entire one side of the airport wondering what the hell was going on. Turns out it was the security line. There had to be over 600 people in this line, all very disgruntled to say the least. It took us over two hours to get to security. We rushed our things through and ran to catch the shuttle with our shoe laces untied. Luckily got onto the shuttle as the doors were closing and sprinted to our gate from there with about 5 minutes to spare before the doors closed and we missed our flight. The thought of missed our flight only to have to go back to ticketing and returning to that torturous security line again was enough to make us prepare to drive two hours to another airport to fly out of. Despite the fact that we made our frontier flight by a hair, we ended up sitting on the plane for another 30 minutes to wait for the 56 (!!) passengers that were still not present for that was supposed to be a full flight. The airline waited for about half of them to get onto the plane and had to leave the other 20 some passengers behind. This experience alone made an otherwise decent trip a horrible experience that we were left with. I will never ever ever fly into or out of this airport again and urge others to consider the same. Aside from the insane waiting and stressful rushing to our gate, the staff at the airport was very rude and cavalier about the situation. Non apologetic, no concern and just flat out rude. I’ve never seen anything like it in my life. On top of everything, we were practically starving for a period of 5 hours since the time we thought we might have to grab a quick bite before our flight was spent stressing in an insane line and frontier doesn’t serve anything on the plan for passengers. I would have rather driven to Florida. Also, I was forced to give this airport one star for some reason, but they deserve negative stars. Steer clear!

Very rude and disrespectful employees! I have been treated so poorly by ever staff member I come into contact with. Where do I start besides saying I am an experienced flier with many miles under my belt. The lady at the Camden food co. Counter slapped the counter several times, forcefully trying to get me to move up in line. I couldn't because the people in front of me were still moving their bags. I said have a nice day and she said "whatever". Shall we start with TSA now? I was being told to step closer by a TSA agent who was farther away. I could not hear them because of the masks. The TSA agent in front of me said, "hey, Dumbo come get in now, shouted and talked down at me just to stand on the yellow feet and put up my arms. She then starts to grab my arm and pull me out of the machine. She said "keep the line moving boy" boy? Who do you think you are. I gave them no reason to treat me like that.

When my family first got here it took an hour to retrieve our luggage. On the day it was time to return home it took an hour to make it through TSA. These lines were nothing I have seen before in my history of traveling. It was worst than customs ×3. They were rude and everyone is doing something different. One say take electronics out while the other say leave it in. Then when I told her the lady just said leave the electronics in, one TSA employee says "I don't know what airport said that to you". I had enough at this point. I told her this airport told me that and as a matter of fact it was your coworker. Ended up missing my flight and had to stay another day.
I read previous reviews about the rudeness of the TSA/check-in staff and surprisingly they were right on. Absolutely rude, that’s all I need to say. Very disappointed!

First, the staff who checked us in were amazing. I was travelling alone with a toddler and they were very helpful. Then I went through Security and that was the worst. I am not a frequent flyer. I explained this. Mind you, the airport was empty. I'm flying for the 2nd time in my life and they huffed and puffed when I asked simple questions. I did not know to get out 4-5 plastic tubs myself for my things, while making sure the grandbaby is still next to me. So they had to help and were very displeased. Then I ask where to find my terminal. The employee rolled his eyes and pointed to the left. I asked if I needed to get on the train. Another employee laughed and asked if I was serious. Yes, in Atlanta you can actually walk to some terminals so I was unsure. Not all people fly all of the time. Have some patience. Treat people with respect and don't assume they know their way around. There were no other passengers anywhere to follow or ask. Sorry I had to interrupt them from socializing with each other, but their rudeness will never be forgotten.

I have the unhappy experience that will bring me to your airport from time to time. I have suffered the tortures of the dammed because the signage is terrible. You closed the B side car rental but you have failed to notify the public. I have looked but found not a single sign. I fly Delta so I use the B terminal. Well to my dismay and consternation I find no signage telling me where to find Delta. I do see a sign that tells me about all the other airlines in the A terminal. What do you have against Delta? Now I know why your airport was rated just above Newark. I wonder if a news report about these shortcomings at MCO would be interesting reading on several websites as I have now twice tried to report these problems on your website but it errors out every time.

Concerns about social distancing. This is 1st travel since pandemic, at check in everything was fine upon going thru security check people were not social distancing there was plenty of TSA agents to in force. Also on Tram no Enforcement. This was not what I had expected.

We arrived at MCO (Orlando Airport) on Mar 18 at 11.00 pm. Airport was fairly empty as expected except apparently a couple of other planes arrived around the same time. Airport security or TSA whomever controls the trams from the gates to the terminal shut down all but 2 tram cars just as 200-250 people were trying to go from gates to the terminal. With all the concern over Covid19 why in the heck would the airport jam all those people into 2 trams. It probably took 2-3 trips back to the terminal to move all the people. We happened to be on the front end of that crowd and once in the tram had no chance to socially distance ourselves from anyone. It was like stuffing sardines into a can. There were 4-6 airport personnel controlling the situation and they all were obvious to any social distancing requirement being imposed for health purposes. It was 11.00 pm which must have been quitting time and they just did what they did every other night when 11.00 pm arrived. Please allow them to understand what is going on in the world today and try to assist in stopping this current virus. If you cannot allow the employees to make better decisions on their own then airport management needs to be in field understanding what is happening in your airport. Shame on airport management.
Worst airport security I’ve ever been through. They don’t know what they are doing and contradict each other. Staff if very rude and not intelligent whatsoever.

If you chew gum to keep your ears sane on takeoff and landing, bring it with you as this airport has outlawed gum. Apparently too many kids spitting it out on their carpets. Watched 3 family's spill the extra large McDs sodas on the carpets with no complaints or cleaning. If you fly from here and kids are screaming on the airplane with ear pain - thank MCO! Fly to Tampa if possible.

commentHeader: customer service needs a lot of attention
reviewContent: This is the worst airport I’ve ever been to. The people at the security are so rude and mean. When the lady was telling me to put my feet in the yellow lines I didn’t hear her so she continued to scream it at me. Next my purse gets checked and the man very rudely asks if I have anything in there that will hurt him. I’m a 20 year old white girl I don’t even know how to work a can opener sometimes. Then he pulls out my victoria secret perfume and says this is too big to go through security so I can destroy right here in front of you or you can mail it to yourself. Throws the perfume at me and doesn’t direct me to any kind of ups or anything so eventually I got tired of going in circles and threw my item away. Now I’m sitting here waiting for my plane and crying. Isn’t this supposed to be about customer service? What is the point of being rude to everyone you encounter? The customer service needs a lot of attention. How can you expect people to enjoy their time and get good reviews if y’all act like this. I haven’t read one good review since because this places is straight trash.

I’ve flown through Orlando six times this year. It is by far the most uncomfortable airport I’ve been in — many people, very little seating or bathrooms. If I ever have to stay in the airport for more than 4 hours, I leave and come back. Maybe that is exactly what the city wants us to do.

One of the worst airports. Huge lines for security at 4am, incredibly rude TSA Agents who subject children to body scanners and subsequent pat down of a sick 13 year old wearing shorts and a thin shirt, and no shoes with nothing in their pockets. Refuse to give their full names or badge numbers or any other identifying info. Never had an issue at any other airport including Philadelphia, BWI, Seattle, Vancouver, Venice, Toronto and others.

commentHeader: this airport is not up to par
reviewContent: Simply stated, this airport is not up to par considering the popular destination of Orlando. People travel from all over the world to visit this city and this is the best the city can do? Trash simply put. 1) Poor restaurant choices. 2) Limited number of restaurants. 3) Horrible selection of restaurants (you've never heard of most of them, few franchises). 4) Horrible security/TSA lines with no organization, crowding people like cattle before the ID check and then subjecting them to a surprise Disney-esque maze lineup after BEFORE getting to screeners. 5) Slow shuttles to gates. 6) Limited seating at Food Court. 7) Limited seating a gates. Seriously, I thought Orlando bills itself as a "worldclass" destination, it's a destination with no class!

commentHeader: easy to get in and out
reviewContent: Great Airport, very clean, easy to get in and out and park with good signage. The airport is also very clean and bright inside with a lot of amenities including restaurants, hotel, and shopping mall. The airport staff and security are friendly and dressed professionally. I would definitely recommend this airport for local and international travel.

commentHeader: truly the armpit of all terminals
reviewContent: I travel to and from this airport monthly and it never ceases to amaze me how incredibly terrible this airport is. It’s dirty. TSA lines are usually long, the agents rude, and the last couple of times the TSA Pre-Check lines have been shut down. The restaurants selections are the worst of any airport in the US I’ve been to and once you get through TSA your choices are even more dismal. Tonight our flight has been delayed by two hours. The only sit down restaurant at our terminal stops serving food at 9 and there’s only one location in the terminal where you can get an adult beverage. This place is truly the armpit of all terminals in the United States.

commentHeader: Low number of restaurants to serve all the gates
reviewContent: Inefficient ticketing and baggage check in. Inefficient TSA line - 3 empty precheck lanes while general check had a 25 min wait. Low number of restaurants to serve all the gates. Dead cockroach in Hall. My wife had to try 3 different bathroom stalls before finding a door that worked.

I just had the pleasure to of being served by Gudny who works for Thomas Cook/Swissport at Orlando (MCO). I cannot tell you how amazing she is. I enquired about a seat change and she went so far above and beyond. We had great banter and she got me an amazing seat with with seat map magic (better than what I was asking for). She is not just an exemplary employee who Thomas Cook/Swiss Port should hold onto for dear life, but just an awesome person.

TSA was extremely rude. Absolutely no help at all when my boarding pass would not scan. I just needed information on what to do but instead I got a rude how stupid are you stare. I pray they all find other jobs that bring them some joy. It’s so much easier to be kind. So sad.

commentHeader: prices are jacked up on every item
reviewContent: This airport has copied every negative aspect of the Orlando experience in that prices are jacked up on every item in the airport to suck away every last penny from the traveler. Items that in any store cost $1.25 were priced at $3.50 - basic sandwiches at over $10. Remind me to drive next time. TSA did a great job despite heavy volume.

commentHeader: by far my least favorite airport
reviewContent: This is by far my least favorite airport to fly into or out of in the entire country. I fly fairly frequently (1-2 times per month) and every time I fly here people are cold, unfriendly, and not helpful at all. I've had people stand and stare at me waiting in line for coffee, only to tell me 5 minutes later they closed the line. I've been yelled at for not getting in the closest general screening line when there is an obvious general line that is shorter. Today, a security agent squeezed behind me with a cart full of bins, then get mad at me when I accidentally backed up and turned around to apologize (never even had the chance to say anything). Other airports also do a far better job of posting what you can and cannot bring on board, but I've been behind someone in security with full-size shampoo products. The seating area is really dirty today, and the bathrooms are overcrowded. I enjoy Chicago airport. I love Denver. Even LAX is tolerable if you have the right attitude. But for some reason, every time I fly through MCO it is a stressful and unpleasant experience.

commentHeader: not one person offered to help
reviewContent: Worst TSA I have ever dealt with. I was traveling with my infant and was gate checking my stroller. We approached security not one person offered to help remove the bassinet from the stroller so it would fit through the belt or help close the stroller. I have my baby in my arms removing my shoes taking out my iPad and struggling to get the stroller on the belt and not one person offered to help. Even after we were scanned and everything had passed through still not one of the 5 TSA who were standing around asked if they could assist me. The security staff here needs a class in customer service. So disgusted with them.

commentHeader: Worst airport I've ever been to
reviewContent: Worst airport I've ever been to. Staff are always rude and always look like they don't want to be there. I was treated like an animal. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

commentHeader: the worst airport I have been to
reviewContent: Orlando International Airport. Airport code MCO. This is not my first time in MCO. I have been to this airport a few times. This is probably the worst airport I have been to. I have travelled to many different cities and countries and gone thru many airports. First, this airport's layout, it is just stupid. They make you go back and forth for no reason and you need to take monorail. The monorail was surprisingly fast and effective. Cleanliness of airport is very questionable. It is not a clean airport. Many places are dirty and the bathroom is Mr Cleans nightmare. I hardly saw any cleaning staff in the airport. What makes this airport the worst is the staff who work in the airport. Many are just rude and lazy. Even the baggage handler thinks he owns the airport. So don’t expect service or courteous here. Most likely you will get yelled at for bothering them. TSA here is joke. I saw 20 TSA, 3 TSA agents working and 17 TSA just standing around talking and laughing. I approached one of TSA to ask question. Her response, “just go over there.” Apparently sharing a joke with her friend is more important than the security of the airport. I thought Newark airport was bad but compared to MCO Newark airport is a well oiled machine. Once again, staff in the airport are what makes this airport the worst airport. Only bright thing about this airport is the immigration agent. Most of them are very professional and courteous. Everyone seems to be trained very well. If possible, avoid this airport.

Rudest TSA security I have ever been to. When you asks questions they dont listen and if they ever answer they will do it in an uninterested or rude way. I have been with other airports, they are nice but here at MCO they are the worst!

No one seems to know what is happening. Staff throughout airport rude and uninterested. Restaurants closing early. Chairs in seating area broken and obviously been that way for a long time. Surely Disney could be encouraged to donate one weeks takings to modernise this awful beginning of people's holidays. If I compare this to Gatwick and Heathrow in England and Schiphol in Holland it is embarrassing to America.

commentHeader: looks like it's stuck in the 1970's
reviewContent: Have experienced this airport on multiple occasions over the last 10 years and every time it's the same. The Airport looks like it's stuck in the 1970's and would need a renovation. Overall the check-in process is smooth, but the security can take longer than expected. There is an ok amount of resturants and bars, and there is not enough seating at the gates leading to a lot of passengers having to stand up.

Coming from Stockholm we had a very long flight only to wait an hour or so before immigration moved just a little at a time. While being there another hours a flight arrived and you saw the passengers arriving into the already established que's only to be yield at by officials as if they were small children and rudely! To get back to the plane they left and stand by. The official also informed those passengers that they were not going to be processed because the airlines they flew did not file the proper paperwork and they were unexpected! We made it through immigration recovered our checked baggage pleasantly surprised by being given a free cart, rolled through the customs door then told to unload the carts were not allowed to be used to take the luggage anywhere and we were told to place our luggage on the conveyor, told it could take as long as 3 hours to show up at the main portion of the airport. No passengers put there luggage while we were there they all struggled and all helped each other carry their luggage back to the main terminal. Ive been to many Airports across the world. Never have I ran into an additional 3 hour process at the end of customs in any airport at any country. What a waste of big money. why did not the airport let the cart vender rent carts out there rather than spend millions on conveyors that no one will want to use. Also no signs or instructions regarding this portion of the process. It was a melt down just waiting to happen every 10 minutes. They had such a nice appearance when we departed, arriving was a nightmare more than anywere Ive been in 30 years. The staff seemed to try to manage dealing with the ridiculous process. It took us a few moments to carefully stack all our luggage up on the free cart. For a 10 second push 15 feet?

Most unpleasant arrival experience in my life. Arrived at 10 pm on January the 7th from Panama and went directly to immigration line (visitors). Very disappointed to see that there were only 2 agents allocated for our line, while that line for locals had more than 7 agents. As a result it took us more than 1:30h to pass the immigration controls. Then, they took me to the customs office with the excuse of having a common name (they didn't provide more explanations but the way the agent explained didn't sound very convincing, besides it was the first time that it happened to me in US territory). Time spent in the office, 30 minutes. After the office I finally got to pick my lugagge, only to discover that it had to go through a 2nd security check and that we had to pick it in another terminal. Sadly when we got to the pick up terminal, part of the lugagge didn't come out. Nobody from the airport or airline was present to assist us. I asked to another passenger in the same situation and he told me that this messy inconvenient was really normal in the airport. We sat for more than 1 hour besides the belts, until the last bag finally came out. It took me 3 hours to fly from Panama to Orlando and incredibly it took me more than 4 hours to try to go out of the Airport. These guys have no idea of customer experience. I know security is a priority but it doesn't give them the right to provide such a poor service. If I don't know how to treat my guests I simply don't invite them.

TSA are disgusting and dehumanizing. This pig of a women was pounding on the plastic barricade and bellowing to people to move up a few inches. I was traveling for work so I had no choice. This is unacceptable.

We arrived later in the evening. Our plane was delayed, so we got something to eat in the main terminal. I'm glad we did, because there were few options near our gate. Because we ate first, security was short (it was horribly long before we ate). My biggest issue is that for an international airport at a major tourist destination, it is horribly outdated. For us, specifically, it is a huge lack of charging stations. We were at the gate 15 waiting area. In that area, there were 6 outlets, each with 2 outlets and 2 USB chargers. That makes a total of 24 people who can charge a device. Get with it. Most modern airports (we live in Denver and use DIA regularly, but have seen it at most other parts airports as well) have seats that charge, so every passenger has the opportunity to do so. In this information age, we all use our devices for everything from business, to email, to boarding passes, to transportation (Uber, etc.). We had been gone from our lodging most of the day and arrived with devices in need for charging. Do you have a plan for when a passenger arrives with an electronic boarding pass, but their phone dies before boarding because they couldn't charge it?

Absolutely horrendous experience going through Orlando International airport! During holiday season travel rush, the airport closed all TSA precheck lines and created massive queues, herding everyone into general security check lines. The staff were extremely incompetent and could not adequately direct the traffic or move the lines along. It was the absolutely worst security experience I have ever experienced of any airport, any country! Avoid MCO at all cost!

If I could give this airport a 0/10 I would. Driving into the airport required a toll road and most rental cars charge more without sun pass. When we finally made it into the airport the signs to return rental cars were quite confusing, we had to go around the entire airport to return our car, when we finally made it to the terminal. the TSA line was long. Food options were very limited and the bathrooms were filthy and smelly!!

commentHeader: no one cares about customer service
reviewContent: The customer service at Nathan's and Burger King on gates 60-99 are the worst customer I have ever received. More than 15 people on line to order and only one register open. The employees show that they do not care. Nathan's always runs out of food that’s in the menu daily and even forks. Looks like no one cares about customer service at those two locations.
This is the third time that I have to wait so long for our baggage. That happened in July with Southwest and in December with Spirit and Frontier. Waiting time, almost an hour.

Terrible signage, terminal train out of service, police officer unprofessional when asked a question. I have traveled 24 round trips this year and find Orlando to be the most unfriendly airport in my long travel history. You know when NY and NJ is better there is a real problem! It is very obvious no cares here, what a shame. At the end of the day one airport has to be the worst and it’s Orlando!

commentHeader: airport has done away with special assistance"
reviewContent: Three planes came in together and there was over 800 people in the immigration hall with three officers on. We saw people collapse and children were crying. We waited over two hours as this airport has done away with special assistance, my wife has muscular dystrophy and is in a wheelchair. We will never again fly into this airport. It’s appalling. What a horrendous way to treat your visitors. Virgin sent us a text before we arrived apologising for the wait in the immigration hall so obviously people had complained to them.

Orlando International has two separate security check points in terminal B that are gate specific. Our boarding pass that we got printed a few minutes prior to going through security didn’t list a gate. Having not been to the airport before we just got into the first check point with our kids and all the carry-ons. It took about 20 minutes before we got to the TSA desk at which time they told us we had to leave and go to the other check point. We then waited in line another 20 minutes to get to the security screening in the second checkpoint line. Our complaint is that first the gate should be printed on the boarding pass as clearly the TSA counter had this information 20 minutes later. Second, there is no signage or employees going around checking to inform travelers they are in the right checkpoint. We all expect some wait at the airport but things like this are simply maddening! Further, when we talked to the TSA folks, they rolled their eyes like this is a very common thing and they wished it wasn’t that way. So my question is this, why isn’t the airport leadership taking this on as an issue to be corrected? Also, the gates for Delta were super crowded! We had to stand the entire time waiting to board, which isn’t easy with small children.

commentHeader: the worst I have ever seen

reviewContent: Avoid at all cost, this is the worst airport I have flown into. The employees are rude and offensive, do yourself a favour fly to Sanford. I will not be flying with Virgin again because they land at this airport in the looses term, I would give it minus If it would let me.

TSA lines 30 minutes or more, and the airport authority staff sitting in various places around the main floor do nothing to inform. This place used to be one of the best. I would now avoid at all costs. Horrible treatment of the flying public.

What a joke! The staff members at this airport are the most rude and ignorant people I have encountered in my life. Be prepared to deal with the worst attitudes possible and for no apparent reason. I have traveled to this airport many times and this will be my last! I refuse to deal with these security and ticket staff. From now on I will just fly into Tampa and drive to Orlando.

Honesty, graciousness and hospitality describe my latest trip to MCO last week. I was traveling there because my daughter was having surgery so my mind was scattered. Once I landed after flying for 5+ hours, I was ready to catch Uber and get to her house before her surgery early the next morning. As I was taking off an outer coat due to the 40 degree warmer weather, I set my purse down. When I gathered my things as the Uber driver came up, I left my purse on the planter. Of course when we got to her house - no purse. My Uber driver was going back to the airport and offered to see if he could locate it when I gratefully appreciated. My daughter went on line to file a lost and found report. We prayed and moments later, a detective  called. They had been trying to locate me for more than 30 minutes. The Security Guard at the airport found my purse and immediately turned it in. When I spoke to the Detective, I thanked him profusely and asked about next steps. He said Lost and Found would contact me the next morning. They did - twice. They confirmed the contents with me and gave me instructions as to how to pick it up. I told them I would come after my daughter's surgery was over and they understood completely. Around 1pm the next day, I went back to the airport and found them - they were already waiting for me. I asked how I could repay them - tips, writing letters of appreciation or what. They said none of that was necessary and asked how my daughter was. All I can say is how much I truly appreciated their integrity, concern and graciousness. I will highly recommend the Orlando Airport and Orlando in general and a wonderful place to visit!

Orlando International Airport is definitely not a friendly user installation. You have to walk and going up and down to reach your luggages and the parking. Also the staff at security gates (TSA) are not fit to handle customers. They are rude, impolite and unprofessional. They need to retrain at Disney Institute, few miles away from the airport, to learn about what is quality service!

TSA/Security is horrendous and caused us to almost miss our flight. We checked the airport app upon arrival and the estimated wait time for Gates 1-59 security was 6-10 minutes. So we took our time, got some coffee, etc. My wife checked the app again a bit later and suddenly the wait time was 22-26 minutes. We hurried over and discovered the chaos that is MCO security. Several times, several lines merged into one or branched from one line to several. It was like herding cattle. The last time the line branched we apparently chose the wrong line.
